ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Memoization can be used to speed up repetitive and computational expensive function calls.  The first time a function that implements memoization is called the results are stored in a cache memory.  The next time the function is called with the same set of parameters, the results are momentarily retrieved from the cache avoiding repeating the calculations.  With this package, any R object can be cached in a key-value storage where the key can be an arbitrary set of R objects.  The cache memory is persistent (on the file system).

Memoization can be used to speed up repetitive and computational expensive function calls.  The first time a function that implements memoization is called the results are stored in a cache memory.  The next time the function is called with the same set of parameters, the results are momentarily retrieved from the cache avoiding repeating the calculations.  With this package, any R object can be cached in a key-value storage where the key can be an arbitrary set of R objects.  The cache memory is persistent (on the file system).

name: r-r.cache
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.17.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-r.cache
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/R.cache_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/R.cache/R.cache_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e265953212edd15be12cdfcc4fa8829cc0dcf3b06ab3e0aa1758108544822d21

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-r.methodss3 >=1.7.1
    - r-r.oo >=1.23.0
    - r-r.utils >=2.8.0
    - r-digest >=0.6.13
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-r.methodss3 >=1.7.1
    - r-r.oo >=1.23.0
    - r-r.utils >=2.8.0
    - r-digest >=0.6.13

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('R.cache')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('R.cache')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/HenrikBengtsson/R.cache
  license: LGPL-2.1-or-later
  summary: Memoization can be used to speed up repetitive and computational expensive function calls.  The first time a function that implements memoization is called the results are stored in a cache memory.  The next time the function is called with the same set of parameters, the results are momentarily retrieved from
    the cache avoiding repeating the calculations.  With this package, any R object can be cached in a key-value storage where the key can be an arbitrary set of R objects.  The cache memory is persistent (on the file system).
  license_family: LGPL
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/LGPL-2.1

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
